沈休文新安江水至清淺深見底貽京邑游好

p.seg: My host, cease your noise a while,
let me sing a bit for you.
I was a gentleman from a poor land
entering service I received the grace of Han.
At first I went with Colonel Zhang (Qian),
and enlisted to go to the Yellow River's source.
Later I served with Light-chariot Li (Cai),
chasing nomads to the limits of the border fortifications.
A close campaign extended ten thousand miles,
even in peaceful years we fled seven times.
Sinews'strength was exhausted in saddle and armor,
my broodings pass through [seasons of] chill and warmth.
The general passed from this world,
and scant battalions and regiments survived.
In one morning the situation of the times had changed,
who again would consider my single accomplishments?
I was young, in my prime, when I left my home,
poor and old, I went back in the gate.
The sicle at my waist mowed mallows and wild beans,
I leaned on my staff, herding chickens and pigs.
Long ago I was like a hawk on the gauntlet,
now I am like a gibbon in a cage.
For nothing a thousand years of bitterness forms,
I helpless bear a lifetime of rancor.
The cast-off mat yearns for the lord's pavilion,
the worn-out horse longs for the lord's carriage.
I wish that the kindness of Jin's lord be extended to me,
that he might not be ashamed before what Tianzi said.
Feathered dispatches rise from a frontier outpost,
beacon fires enter Xianyang.
Troops called to arms assemble at Guangwu,
the soldiers are divided to rescue the Northland.
In harsh autumn the sinews [bows] and shafts are stiff;
the ranks of the Turks are well-drilled and strong.
The Son of Heaven grasps his sword in rage,
envoys see one another from afar.
'Goose files' [the army] follow along rocky paths;
'Strung fish formations' cross soaring bridges.
In the pipes and drums is borne longing for the Han;
pennons and armor are covered by Turkish frost.
Swift winds rise, crashing against the barrier gates,
sand and gravel is whirled aloft.
The horses' coats are coiled up like a hedgehog ["s spines],
the horn-bows cannot be drawn.
In times of peril one sees the subjects resolve;
in the an ages turmoil one recognizes the loyal and good.
They sacrifice themselves to repay the enlightened ruler,
though their bodies die, they are the nation's dead.
White horse, a well-wrought bow of horn,

div.head: 陸韓卿中山王孺子妾歌一首

p.seg: whip's cracking carried on the north wind.
On the key route he asks of alarums on the frontier:
mixed tribes have entered Yunzhong Commandery.
They have closed the wall since the past summer,
cleared the meadows [in front] straight to winter.
The campaign baggage is often missing,
expedition clothes are rarely cut amd sewn.
Their bodies went under holding the Han domains,
they lost their lives facing the Turkish borders.
At twilight the frontier clouds rise up,
flying sands cover the pines far away.
Holding back grief they gaze toward two capitals,
with Chu songs they climb the ramparts on all sides.
The grown men erred in the plans they made,
this life has been endowed to have low position.
They have cast off all love in the heartland,
in hopes of great deeds on a Turkish horse.
Off now, what's to be said,
this life has been endowed to have low position.
Just let the lads on the frontier know

p.seg: that I alone was the bravest.
